pullRequest.title: Expose protocol name at `ConnectionContext` API

commit.message:
Expose protocol name at `ConnectionContext` API

Motivation:

Users should have a way to determine which application level
protocol is used by each connection.

Modifications:

- Add `ConnectionContext.protocol()` method;

Result:

Users can understand the protocol used by each connection.

nodes.bodyText: Should we make GrpcProtocol public? There is no additional info (like version or something else) except the name.

nodes.bodyText:
that represents a network connection. => for a connection
As the context may not represent the entire connection.
I would suggest moving this as an inner interface of ConnectionContext as this is for informational purpose returned from ConnectionContext.

nodes.bodyText: nit: static import here and below for HttpClients.forSingleAddress

As gRPC is a layered application protocol, I think it is valuable to provide the underlying protocol (HTTP/1/2/3) information. We can either nest Protocol:
GrpcProtocol#httpProtocol()
or just create top level constants: GrpcProtocol#GRPC_OVER_HTTP_1, GrpcProtocol#GRPC_OVER_HTTP_2, etc
I have a slight preference for top-level constants.

As this connection does not implement any protocol per se, I would suggest:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param protocol The {@link Protocol} this {@link DefaultNettyConnection} implements.
          
          
            
                 * @param protocol {@link Protocol} for the returned {@link DefaultNettyConnection}.
